description.narrative: Output 5.2: By 2018, families, communities, schools and institutions are equipped with the tools to ensure the continuity of education for children affected by crises, especially girls and the most vulnerable, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2018, school-age children, particularly girls, children who live in rural areas and vulnerable children, have access to and make greater use of quality basic education services

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE LA POSTE ET DES NOUVEL TECHNOLOGIES DE L INFORMATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.2: By 2018, families, communities, schools and institutions are equipped with the tools to ensure the continuity ofeducation for children affected by crises, especially girls and the most vulnerable

description.narrative: Insecurity in Niger worsened during 2018 with cross-border attacks in Tillabery and Tahoua regions bordering Mali and Burkina Faso, and Diffa region on the Lake Chad basin, including attacks targeting schools. UNICEF contributed to ensure the continuity of education of 24,036 children and youths including 9,780 newly-enrolled children (6,599 girls). | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019

title.narrative: Number of children (boys and girls) aged 9-14 years targeted by UNICEF that have access to quality non-formal education
Number of children (boys and girls) aged 7-12 years targeted by UNICEF that have access to a quality education
